column1: #Text=[0250] The heat and mass balance was determined for the process with the configuration shown in FIG. 1.
#Text=This process includes a membrane separation reformer having the configuration as shown in FIG. 3.
#Text=[0251] The pre-reformer A2, which is packed with a Ru-based catalyst and performs a steam reforming reaction at an outlet temperature of 550.degree.
#Text=C. and pressure of 1 MPa, is fed with 215 kg/h of naphtha (line 100) and 946 kg/h of steam (not shown).

#Text=A partially reformed gas obtained from the pre-reformer joins a recycle gas fed from the recycle line A106 and is then introduced into the reforming reaction tube 1b of the membrane separation reformer A1.
#Text=A nickel-based steam reforming catalyst is packed in a reforming reaction tube whose outlet temperature is set at 600.degree.
#Text=C. decomposes the carbon-containing fuel to produce hydrogen.

#Text=At the same time, a part of the produced hydrogen permeates the hydrogen-permeable membrane 1c constituting a part of the wall of the reforming reaction tube and consisting of a Pd-based alloy and flows through the space (hydrogen channel) 1d to yield 34.5 kmol/h of high purity hydrogen having a purity of 99.99% (line A102).

#Text=[0252] As the off-gas of the membrane separation reformer (line A103), there is obtained a mixed gas having a total gas flow rate excluding steam of 23.6 kmol/h, a CO.sub.2 concentration of 50%, and a hydrogen concentration of 35%.

#Text=The mixed gas is dewatered with a dewaterer (not shown) and then introduced into the CO.sub.2 separation membrane A3 including a membrane having a CO.sub.2/hydrogen permeability coefficient ratio .alpha. of 30.

#Text=The permeation side gas (line A105) of the CO.sub.2 separation membrane has a CO.sub.2 concentration of 98%, which is pressurized to about 8 MPa by the compressor A6 and then fed into the CO.sub.2 liquefier A5 from the line A109 to yield 8.7 kmol/h of a liquefied-CO.sub.2 flow (line A110).

#Text=The non-permeation side gas (line A107) of the CO.sub.2 separation membrane is introduced, at a pressure as it is, into the hydrogen separation membrane A4 provided with a polyimide membrane having a CO.sub.2/hydrogen permeability coefficient ratio .alpha. of 0.11.

#Text=On the permeation side of the hydrogen separation membrane, there is obtained 4.7 kmol/h of a gas (line A108) having a hydrogen concentration of 94% and a pressure of 0.1 MPa, which is recycled upstream of the membrane separation reformer A1 through the compressor A7 and the line A106.

#Text=On the other hand, the non-permeation side gas (line A111) of the hydrogen separation membrane and the off-gas of the CO.sub.2 liquefier (line A112) are combined to form a gas flow (line A113), which is sent to the reformer burner 1e, used as a fuel for combustion in the reformer, and then discharged (line A122).
